plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant known for its large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun's movement across the sky. Native to North America, it is widely cultivated for its seeds and oil.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism when young, turning to face the sun throughout the day before their heads become fixed facing east.

plants.name: Lilium lancifolium
plants.description: A striking perennial lily species with bright orange flowers spotted with dark maroon, known for its hardiness and vibrant appearance.
plants.funFact: Tiger lilies have bulbils in their leaf axils, which can fall to the ground and sprout new plants, aiding in their spread.

plants.name: Agapanthus africanus
plants.commonName: African Lily or Lily of the Nile
plants.description: An evergreen perennial plant with clusters of funnel-shaped blue or white flowers, native to South Africa and popular in ornamental gardening.
plants.location: South Africa, cultivated in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Agapanthus flowers are believed to be a symbol of love and are often used in wedding bouquets.

plants.name: Delphinium elatum
plants.description: Tall, showy perennial plants producing spiked flowers in various shades of blue, purple, pink, or white. Native to the Northern Hemisphere.
plants.funFact: Delphiniums have a unique flower structure with a spur at the back, which is a nectar reservoir accessible only to long-tongued pollinators.
